  + ### City Council Meetings

    The City Council holds its regular meetings on the 3rd Tuesday of every month at 5:00 p.m., unless otherwise noted. The agendas are posted on the website 72 hours prior to the meetings. Minutes of the meetings are posted on the website after approval by the City Council.

### City Council Meetings

The City Council holds its regular meetings on the 3rd Tuesday of every month at 5:00 p.m., unless otherwise noted. The agendas are posted on the website 72 hours prior to the meetings. Minutes of the meetings are posted on the website after approval by the City Council.

* Mayor Keith Brown
* Mayor Pro-Tem Susan Schwartz,
  *Position 2*
* Eric Thode,
  *Position 1*
* Carl Moerer,
  *Position 3*
* Josh Pratt,
  *Position 4*
* Andrew Poor,
  *Position 5*

![](https://bunkerhilltx.gov/templates/bunker/images/inner-bodybg.jpg)

At the City Council meeting held on April 16, 2024, Council unanimously approved Ordinance No. 24-625 to regulate the use of electric bikes (e-bikes) and e-scooters on City streets and sidewalks. The ordinance classifies e-bikes and e-scooters based on motor type and speed to regulate their safe operation in public spaces. This measure helps ensure the compatibility of e-bikes with other...

[Read more](https://bunkerhilltx.gov/latest-news/e-bike-safety)

In 2021, City Council approved the construction of a new Public Works and Disaster Operations Building. This new facility will not only house Public Works personnel but also act as the City’s Emergency Operations Center during major emergency situations. The new facility is scheduled to be operational Fall 2023.
What is BHV Inc.?
The City has established a non-profit corporation (BHV...

[Read more](https://bunkerhilltx.gov/latest-news/public-works-fundraiser)

The City of Bunker Hill Village invites residents to volunteer on a City Committee. This Committee system is intended to provide an avenue for direct input from those who live here, and give the City an opportunity to benefit from the considerable expertise represented by...

[Read more](https://bunkerhilltx.gov/latest-news/volunteer-for-city-functions-3)
